alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 8:55PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Burlington, Camden, and Gloucester. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 854 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen over the last hour or so, with additional rainfall of 0.5 to 1.5 inches possible over the next 1 to 2 hours. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Medford, Berlin, Chesilhurst, Atco, Marlton Lakes, Sicklerville, Williamstown, Monroe Township, Victory Lakes, Pine Hill, Medford Lakes, and Pine Valley. - This includes the following highways... Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 32 and 40. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
